DataElement.preferredName: BRIEF Health Literacy Screening Tool 3 How Often Have Problems Learning About Medical Condition Due to Difficulty Understanding Written Information Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often they have problems learning about their medical condition because of difficulty understanding written information, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: BRIEF Health Literacy Screening Tool How Often Have Problems Learning About Medical Condition Due to Difficulty Understanding Written Information Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized four-item questionnaire developed by Haun et al. in 2009 that utilizes a five-point Likert rating scale to assess the adequacy of an individual's health literacy._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._A question about whether an individual has or had problems learning about their medical condition because of difficulty understanding written information._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized four-item questionnaire developed by Haun et al. in 2009 that utilizes a five-point Likert rating scale to assess the adequacy of an individual's health literacy.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
